title: Cameras good app average
text: Cameras work good x2 HD slims and were the only slim ones that would fit in the narrow area I had without major mods to mounting. Picture /video quality is good. After a few years I had the plastic bracket just fall off and SkyBell sent me a replacement. One of the cameras motion sensor plastic cover has fallen off but still works. Silicone works good around the sides to seal up bc I have spiders living in one of mine setting the motion off lol. It would be nice if night mode had a option to disable the lights so to see the actual night video instead of reflections from the led lights which drown out the pictures beyond 3-5 feet. The app stopped getting updates over a year ago and it sometimes crashes and locks up. Also I‚Äôve noticed random disconnects from the cams to the iPhone app even though I have WiFi extenders everywhere and WiFi signal is strong. Does the cameras receive firmware updates causing reboots randomly? Any chance there will be updates to the App and firmware soon? I can‚Äôt really complain though as skybell is one of the few cams that doesn‚Äôt require a subscription which I really like and appreciate. The cams I will give a 4/5. And the app 3/5. Thanks again for reading my review.

text:

text: The color night vision is awesome the app is not up to par I cant integrate it with google and I‚Äôm forced to change this bell The  of motion detections don‚Äôt allow you to grid events by day so you have to scroll scroll scroll and after you watch the recorded event it takes you back to the top again then guess what you have scroll scroll scroll so frustrating and it disconnects about 2 times a month I tried my best and 2 years equals patience the app hasn‚Äôt updated since I was waiting for an update but the look of the product and the quality of camera is amazing hd and radius of coverage is my whole block and street but it needs a better app it should launch updates to keep the bugs fixed and up to date of tech savvy ones I think I will wait 6 more months and pray for an update

title: Return ASAP
text: If we could return our SkyBell we would but it came preinstalled when we bought the place. From the beginning it was not great. To start we had a difficult time getting it to connect. Once it finally started working we found that it doesn‚Äôt detect motion well. It should detect motion within 5 feet but we have people walk right up to the door and it doesn‚Äôt notify us. Some homeless guy came up and used our patio outlet to charge his phone at 2am and we had no idea. The outlet is practically below the doorbell. It wasn‚Äôt until the guy came back to check on his phone that we were notified of motion. The video starts at the top of the guys head because he is already bent over checking his phone. Now we have no audio and we cannot review videos of recorded activity. The audio went out when our device was updated to the new iOS 12 a couple weeks ago. Skybell‚Äôs reply when I reported this was to uninstall iOS 12 if audio is important. Easier said then done. Now we have no audio, we are not being notified of all activity near our door, and now it‚Äôs been more than 2 days since our log updated any activity. If you haven‚Äôt bought skybell don‚Äôt. title: Skybell started working again!
text:
I bought a competitor's doorbell to replace the Skybell because I was frustrated. The motion detector had not worked properly since June and for the last 3 weeks, nothing worked. I wrote Skybell and they updated me unannounced to Firmware 1148. Out of the blue, I got a motion detection,  but my wifi strength took a nosedive for no reason. The doorbell was working again in the way I had intended it to when I bought it. I'm returning the other doorbell.

I still would like to know what the 4 filters(motion, button, on demand, integration) and I can't find that information anywhere. What exactly do all the filters do if they are checked and applied. That's my only small criticism

title: Do not recommend
text: I‚Äôve had mine for over a year now. I purchased SkyBell because it would integrate with my Total Connect. At first, it worked pretty good. It never had a good connection to the network, but it worked most of the time. Slowly it got worse, until the device was offline a lot, then always. title: Needs improvements
text:
So I live in a large building and they‚Äôve included this SkyBell for all units. Since I‚Äôm not in a neighborhood, this thing goes off often, so I‚Äôve had to turn off the notifications for motion. The camera and doorbell work well. No complaints there, however, the app needs a lot of improvements.

App cons:
If you view a video in the ‚Äúactivity‚Äù feed, once you‚Äôre done viewing the video, the app automatically takes you all the way to the top of the videos instead of keeping you in the place you‚Äôre searching (so if you‚Äôre searching for videos that are towards the bottom, you get sent to the top and have to scroll all the way down through all the other videos when searching for a specific event). title: Buy the Nest Hello or Ring
text: There‚Äôs a reason why the other manufacturers sell more - they have their devices and the apps figured out. I had this doorbell-cam professionally installed and immediately it. Let‚Äôs not even talk about the issues with the doorbell itself yet - just the misleading advertising is enough to trash this doorbell. (I personally prefer the Nest - I was able to install it myself in about an hour and it‚Äôs been amazing ever since we turned it on)

title: No sleazy subscription ‚Äúservice‚Äú.
text:
Favorite thing about the skybell is that there is no sleazy subscription ‚Äúservice‚Äù to view my own videos, so based on that alone this is the best doorbell camera available that I know of.  Amazing to me that some people are dumb enough to pay infinite monthly fees for stuff like that, btw.

title: Why are they so behind

title: Free Free Free
text: Have had this for more than two years now and still works fine even after 105 degree highs and -20 lows. I‚Äôd estimate that 90% of the time the motion detection works fine, sometimes light changes and wind can cause false detections and on occasion it may not pick up a package delivery. title: Thank goodness for v4.1.1 update!
text:
Ever since v4.0.0 (and incl v4.0.1 and v4.0.2), the app would ALWAYS crash on both my iPhone SE and my wife‚Äôs iPhone 5S, both on the current iOS versions ... this was obviously because the Skybell dev‚Äôs weren‚Äôt testing or reading the older 4‚Äù screen size. text:

title: Works Flawlessly!
text: I‚Äôve had my SkyBell HD installed for over two years. title: Should have went with Ring
text:
Loved this at first, first month: loved not having a subscription cost, the motion sensor worked great, the live video and intercom worked great. 5 stars. Even bought one for my parents home.

Fast forward month by month it all got worse until today, a little over a year in:  the motion sensor works 1 out of 10 times the delivery man comes straight up to the door. title: Does NOT support all door bells out of the box
text:
For every house there is a different door bell. As such, you may find yourself in the situation where you need to pull more money out of your wallet to purchase their adapter, different transformer(will not work on 120v AC), a resistor for DC connection, and so on.
I am not complaining about the extra price  that I need to pay for those items, but I complain about the extra work and research needed to implement this video doorbell into a regular house.
Voltage, AC, DC, AMPs, electricity safety, a voltmeter and knowledge how to work with it, are just a few of the drawbacks.
I am an IT tech and by far I am more knowledgeable and ready to pick up the needed info to accomplish the task of connecting it and configure it, but the hurdles don‚Äôt stop here, and for other, they don‚Äôt even get to the point of configuring the device.
So now, the device blinks different color codes, and you will match each type of blinking to a map/legend. Let‚Äôs say for a minute - no biggie - but now the device does not do what it is supposed to do - e.g. syncing, broadcasting video and sound, in 20 attempts it works maybe once, if you‚Äôre lucky.
Now, luck is not a thing for a computer guy. Electronics should be binary, either work, or not. Anything in between is not acceptable.
Not a good job, skybell.

title: Overall a great product.
text: I have installed HUNDREDS AND HUNDREDS of these. I have 4 at my house. They work about 90% of the time AS LONG AS YOU HAVE GOOD WIFI. Don‚Äôt complain if you have garbage WiFi on the other side of your house. Anyway, you need AC or DC power which is nice. Minimum 2mbps upload is really what works well. I‚Äôve installed them with a .3mbps upload and it worked. The biggest issue people had was it not ringing inside their house. You need a GOOD functioning doorbell for it to work.  If you don‚Äôt, then it won‚Äôt work like that. I‚Äôve talked to reps at skybell and said they really need to add an in line chime between the skybell and the transformer to fix this issue.  All things considered they‚Äôre great. Easy set up and pretty reliable.

title: Great Value
text:
I‚Äôve owned a SkyBell since 2016 and now have had them in two houses.  My bottom line is that there is tremendous value and it seems others have had bad experiences but mine has been a good one. I haven‚Äôt owned Ring or any other video doorbell so I can‚Äôt speak to comparisons but what I do know is that my motion activation has worked well, I get alerts on my phone and I do not have to pay any sort of monthly fee to see my archived video. 

Most recently the unit disconnected from my router when Netgear updated their firmware on my Orbi unit. I called SkyBell support after trying to resync myself and they walked me through tying the unit the 2.4 GHz channel of the Orbi Mesh network and the unit is back up and running.  

Good unit, good value.

title: Why all the hate? Doorbell works great.
text:
I‚Äôve had the sky bell for three years. During this time the doorbell has worked flawlessly along with the app. However there are a few things that I wish they would update on the software.

title: Don‚Äôt do it

title: I like it

title: Don‚Äôt buy a SkyBell
text:

text:

text:

title: Skybell
text:

title: What happened?
text:

title: Needs improvement
text:
The hardware itself has some major design flaws that contribute to overall poor performance.  The wifi connectivity isn't great and basically demands that you have a rock solid router located 15 feet or less from your front door with 6 Mbps upload speed.  

I have a very high end router, 8 Mbps upload speed (when running a speed test from my phone on my front doorstep), and my router is located about 10 feet inside my front door. 

The connectivity is still hit or miss.  I've tried these doorbells on a lot of different network configurations at different houses and even in the "best case scenario," the performance will be inconsistent at times.

The motion detection will only work in some instances and not others depending on the layout of your porch, the ambient temperature, and the direction people take will approaching your door.  Don't count on it.

Live chatting with a visitor is unlikely unless the person stands there for quite some time and you react to the notification instantly.  

The app doesn't tell you the temperature outside, so this is just plain false advertising.  This is not a critical feature, but they still shouldn't advertise something that it doesn't actually do.

I look forward to future generations of products like this to make some major improvements that are vital to delivering a good user experience.

text:
After researching and trying several different video door bells most of which were problematic, I settled on the SkyBell HD, because if you get it from SkyBell, you can use their servers which save the videos recorded for several days before discarding them. 

I‚Äôve had it over a month and it usually works. It alerts us to motion at the front door, even when an insect crawls over the camera lens. Unfortunately it does not always bring up the live view very quickly, which can be a pain when a delivery person is at the front door. It also periodically hangs, necessitating a reboot of my iPhone 8. Also the icons for talking or canceling during live view sometimes disappear making it necessary to reboot the iPhone. Some of the slow behavior switching into live view may be due to an undersized, under powered server for handling all the video.

I ended up getting the slim line model because they were out of the round ones.

You need to make sure your router is set up correctly and that it or an extender is close enough to the door bell to connect to it.

In short, the hardware seems serviceable, the app needs work and their server needs a boost in capacity. It would be nice if one could use ones own NAS and store the video‚Äôs locally. This would require them either writing the necessary software or publishing the hardware specs and the API for it so some one else could do that.

Aug 27, 2020
   The performance has dropped to the point where it is almost unusable. The UPS man came this morning and while the alert sound came to my phone, the device did not record the UPS man, but it did record me opening the door to pick the package up. The watch live function now takes minutes to load. Not useful for remote answering of the door. They really need to increase the bandwidth of their servers and improve the efficiency of their app. Until those problems are fixed, I can‚Äôt recommend this device.

title: Works Okay...
text:
Device: (1) Needs to support WDR/HDR (wide dynamic range/high dynamic range).  Doorbell is on a covered porch so people are always "backlit" by a brighter scene behind them.  Once a person is finally in range to trigger motion, they're simply a black shadow. (2) Motion detection is iffy at all sensitivities and typically triggers as someone is pushing the doorbell, has been standing right next to the door for 5-10 seconds, or is actually opening the door. Worse during the day and at night after outside lights have been tuned off. At moderate lighting levels (cloudy, dusk, dawn, other porch lights on), it actually produces a really good picture. (3) Too many LED lights. When the motion detection triggers the light reflects off the wall behind and to the side and washes out some of the picture at night. With no WDR/HDR, the camera adjusts to the brightest part of the scene and it's difficult to see.

App: (1) A little slow to notify for motion and button pushes. (2) App starts too slow. Combined with the slow notification, on button pushes, the person is typically pushing the doorbell for a second or third time as I'm trying to answer them.

Overall, it's ok with the capability to be really good. When the lighting is right, it's spot on with what I was looking for.

Four stars for some quirks in the app. Some of the setting changes require a system reboot to take effect. Also, there is no way to multi select videos for deletion.

Also have one issue from time to time but not very often, when I get the notification and I try to login  it sometimes doesn't let me connect for a few minutes so not sure if the device is hanging on something. Otherwise I can always connect with no issues.

title: I love SkyBell HD
text:
Update from my review below. 

Jeremy from SkyBell reached out to me shortly after I posted my review. (below) He resolved my issue in just a few minutes. Now that's customer service! To be fair, I left out in my review that SkyBell is a fantastic product. My issues were not with the camera, but more software related. All is working again and I am going to continue to recommend this product. 

Original review - But after the latest update I get 3 notifications in a row for everything. Please fix this!  Also, the sensor is either too high and detects everything or too low and detects nothing. Used to work fine. It detects a school bus driving down the road, but won't recognize people leaving or coming to the door.

title: Good, when it works
text:
Like others have reported, it functions intermittently.  Sometimes I can view live, but other times it's just a black screen.  It also seems to report false motion/notifications... or just delayed/repeated notifications from previous activity.  

When it does work, the interaction is relatively slow.  Especially when you're far away from the camera itself (like being at work).  When I receive notification that motion has been detected, the person is typically gone by the time I'm able to connect and view the live feed.

I like the idea of having a doorbell camera, but this one and the app could use some more polishing to make it more usable.  I see this more as a tracking tool (to see who has been to your door), as opposed to having it as a live feed security device.

title: Error loading activity..
text:
I love my Skybell but I have been getting errors lately where I can not get into the settings and when I select to view the live feed its black and then the enviable error loading activity message comes. What happen to this app? It use to be a constantly well running app but not I cringe every time I go into it because of the constant errors. Yearning for the old days of this once reliable app.

Follow up. Still getting loading errors. I have deleted and added and rebooted etc. Close to moving on to something more reliable.

Follow up. Customer service exchanged by defective Skybell HD and the new one works great! Thank you Skybell for the great customer service and I am enjoying my doorbell as I did in the past!

title: Very Good Doorbell and Very Good App!
text:
We recently installed our new SkyBell HD and the app.  Installation of the device couldn't be much easier.  Connecting it to the app was fast and simple.  The video quality is excellent, both during the day and at night.  The motion detector works well.  My only con is that the audio could be a little better.  It works fairly well...both parties (me using the app and the person outside) can hear and understand each other) but the audio quality at my end is a little muffled.

I would give this 4 and a half stars if I could because of the audio.  But, since I'm overall very pleased with the product and the app I'm leaning to the 5 star rating.

title: Sky bell HD
text: Even when set to the highest motion sensitivity, it takes up to 1-2 minutes before the sky bell detects activity. I have walked out the front door and waved my arms and jumped up and down in front of the camera and it still takes up to 45 seconds before it acknowledges motion. I have received several packages delivered by the front door and Skybell did not even record or figure out that motion had occurred. I have several Nestcams inside my house that immediately start recording if motion is detected..... I want my doorbell to immediately record when motion is detected but Skybell isn't that doorbell. Also, now the app crashes as soon as I try to go into "settings". I have deleted app and reinstalled.... I have deleted doorbell and reinstalled.... Still the app is crashing when I try to go into settings!

title: New version is odd
text:
Prior to the new version my phone would connect to the doorbell within 30 seconds. Usually allowed you to see them walking away. Now it's just a black screen saying it can't connect to the video stream. My doorbell is 17 feet away from the access point which is behind one wall. AP shows full signal. Also tried asus wireless router. Both result in the same thing. Also tried switching the phone to cellular.  Same problems. I have a full any rule for the MAC address of the doorbell. May be returning it.

November 2017: hasn‚Äôt worked since my last review. We use it to see that packages were deceived once it lets us download the video it records. Does not work live. Wireless access point is 17 feet away. Added an extra camera using synology surveillance station that actually lets us view who is at the front door. This doorbell is a waste of money.

title: Where is history?
text:
I‚Äôve had the SkyBell for over a year without issue. Recently (last update) my activity feed stopped updating. 
I bought a WiFi mesh to extend coverage and improve connection at the device, and now have 20mBit+ down / 12+ up and SkyBell shows a ‚Äògood signal‚Äô. 
I still get notifications on my phone (iPhone X) and tablet (older iPad), but still no historical feed. 
In the past SkyBell had been so laggy that I needed to watch the historical feed; now I cannot even do that. Hopefully the increased bandwidth at the device will improve lag times. But, until they update this app to get me historical videos again, this is mostly useless.

title: App and Product are Terrible don't waste your time or money
text: If you have not bought a SkyBell yet then don't, this thing is terrible not only is it hard to set up but it also does not work reliably at all. The streaming feature almost never connects, so you can never see a live video stream. Then the motion sensor does not work great and it misses people walking up and knocking on the door all the time. And on the times it does catch it, it will notify you that someone came to your door but then when you go to the video history the video will never show up. Overall this product and app is substandard and needs a lot of work. So if you just bought your skybell and can return it then do it or if you are thinking about buying one don't go with some other product because this one is garbage.

title: When it works, it's great.
text: About 80 percent of the time I try to open the app I get this message. "There was an error loading activity history for this skybell. Please try again later". This error keeps me from using any features of the app & device. I've already called customer support and the representative didn't know why this problem is happening or how to fix it. My wifi is not the problem. My service is fast enough and the router is about 12 feet away from the device (through a stucco wall & window). I've deleted the app and reinstalled it multiple times, updated the app and reinstalled the device. Is there anything that can be done or fixed?!?

title: Great Product!
text: I absolutely love this product! It was really easy to install and set up. It alerts me every time someone comes to my door or walks past the general area. My husband and I have both had our cars broken into in the last couple of months so I ended up buying another SkyBell and installing it above my garage. It works great and feel confident if they break in again we will know who it is. The camera is really clear even at night and you can zoom in on the picture which helps! I would definitely recommend this product!

title: Amazing product and app!
text: This works great, video & sound quality is amazing and I already feel more secure being able to see who is at my door without opening it. Installation and setup was super easy. One minor suggestion...I wish the notification tone for motion detection only was different and not a doorbell sound. The doorbell sound is great when someone actually presses it but I'd like to be able to tell by the sound if it is motion only or an actual doorbell press...otherwise great product! I will be recommending it.

title: Very satisfied customer
text:
I've had the Skybell Classic and absolutely love it! It was super simple to hook up and a breeze to set up. My in laws just recently purchased their first Skybell because my wife and  I love our so much!  I've recently 
coincided upgraded to the HD version so I contacted Skybell technical support with some question. Needless to say they were extremely helpful in answering all my questions regarding the HD version. Defiantly recommend Skybell over the competitors because you don't have the added cost the competitors charge you!

title: Motion detections is not that good and log in to much
text: I use the ring bell before and I return it just for one reason there was not on demand video now they have it the motion sensor is more accurate better than the sky bell, the sky bell is ok but need to be more accurate the notification are few seconds off by time you see them is too late. title: Best Smart Doorbell on the market
text:
My original connection was laggy because my router is dual band, but that was fixed once I separated the the two bands in my router settings and linked my skybell hd wifi settings to ONLY my 2.4ghz network, then things began to work smoothly. 

Overall I like my skybell HD and rate the device itself 4stars (it would be nice if it wasn't made of plastic). Video and audio quality is great! Installation and set up was easy! Customer support is helpful! Price off $200 is fair.

title: Clear, Simple, Easy Setup
text: I'm not a tech or handy guy but my wife bought this product and I was a little nervous to set it up but the app and the video setup was short, easy to understand and to the point. The setup for the product was super easy even for a guy like me that is not handy. Loving the product and the notifications I get with the packages that come to my door. I'm definitely getting this product for friends and family for the holidays.

title: Great & not so
text: What others have stated before, settings can,- in the current version-, not be accessed by an iPhone 6 or higher (crash). This needs to be fixed. What's great is the video quality. BUT, as it is in my situation, the doorbell is situated in a 90 degree angle to the door. This means for the longest time, approaching visitors won't get captured by Skybell HD. As a result, (at best), my videos shows only the people from behind as they leave the vicinity of the door. The software needs a buffer, which shows several seconds BEFORE the trigger-event happened.

title: Night and Day difference! WOW 3rd time IS a charm!
text: Ok I was one of the original adopters of the indiegogo campaign and needless to say the product AND the app were horrific. Version 2 wasn't any better. IF you had either of those and lost confidence, you have ABSOLUTELY nothing to worry about - but with confidence and KNOW the app is just as amazing. Super easy to hook up, app programs EVERYTHING by itself and it finally "just works."  Love the new product and the new app - you can't go wrong!!!!

title: Cold weather means constant, false motion detection.
text:
The past five weeks have turned our normally reliable motion detection to a grinding halt. Passing cars (40‚Äô away) set off notifications. Sensitivity settings make no difference. We‚Äôve had to switch off notifications so we can sleep at night. We can‚Äôt use this very important feature.

I contacted SkyBell customer support and was informed that this is a known issue, and a future firmware update will take care of it.

With solid competition, I have to consider changing brands if you can‚Äôt fix this problem.

title: Possibly one of the worst devices I‚Äôve used
text:
I have tried multiple versions of SkyBell and I have to say it is one of the worst consumer product experiences to date.  Plain and simple, it doesn‚Äôt work!   Video quality is horrible.  Audio can not even be heard by people standing front of my door.  And that is if I can even connect to the device when someone presses the button.   My ‚Äúinfrastructure‚Äù is fairly simple.  150Mbps up and down with Apple Airplay Routers and trying to access on Wifi or LTE works about 50% of the time.   

The bottom line is that this product should still be in beta.   I‚Äôm not happy and experience with other doorbells have been much better.

title: Randomly works
text: I ditched the Ring Pro because it couldn't handle high degree temperature. I decided to buy SkyBell however the motion detection randomly works. I had UPS drop off a box at my front door. I received a text message from UPS that my package had been delivered. Huh? I quickly ran downstairs and open my front door and there was my packages. SkyBell never notified me nor did the motion detection turned on. I decided to jump in front of the unit and the motion detection kicked in. 99% of the time, I get a recording when the person pushes the button rather then motion.

title: So progressive!
text:
I've had a skybell for over 6 months now and the app keeps getting better and better. I like that they are adding features while keeping it easy to use. Quick rings and history is easy to manage. Looking forward to the next 6 months!
Regular app updates when needed and they keep adding things customers ask for. To me that's a sign of a really good company. Keep up the good work Skybell!

title: Better than before
text: Motion recording is so much better now, it records right when someone comes on camera.  I would say it's improved from the last version and would have to say better than Ring Doorbell.  The only con is that sometimes saved recordings show up a few minutes to a couple of hours later.  Still a work in progress I suppose but definitely the best version yet.

title: not great
text: I talked a friend into getting one, we both have the same issue... if the button is pressed, it rings all the devices (so that is great)... but you will never see the video from it real time... if you open the app and click live video, same thing... ALWAYS an error... it does seem to do ok recording the video when the button is pressed, but that never helps me... i want to be able to see it real time. i thought it was just my house / my wireless, even though the device shows ‚Äúgreen‚Äù for connection... but when my friend said his does the exact same thing... i was like... huge bummer!! i would not buy this device again...

title: I really love the HD version!!!
text:
Update:  Thank you for the new version!  I love the new features!!!  My Dad and 2 siblings now have it and love it as well!

I had a Ring first for 6 months (glitchy and hated the huge size) and then a non-HD SkyBell for about a year and a half which was a big improvement.  After seeing the HD picture that a friend had, I upgraded.  Liked it before but now, it's so clear it is just AMAZING!  I'm also loving all of the features!

title: A little good.  A lot of bad!
text:
SkyBell HD is a mixed bag. The video is outstanding ...the app is easy to use. But it's main feature of motion detection is horrible. The amount of false alerts is intense to the point a user has to turn off the option. 

Even with this new update (which now allows users to select different trigger sensitivity), the false alarms are only cut in half at the lowest setting. For a motion detecting security camera this is severely disappointing. There are plenty of other companies and products that I've gotten this right. Their inability to master this issue is getting to be a little pathetic.

title: SkyBell Hd
text: The wind chime is really low.  I actually use my motion on my camera and the door bell sound woke me up letting me know someone was underneath my carport at 2:55am.  Now this new sound is low and you can barely hear it.  Think we should be able to change the sound ourselves. Other than that change this doorbell camera is one of the best.  I would recommend it and I have told a lot of people about it already.

title: Works wonderfully
text:
It works. However, there are annoyance in the beginning. One of the power screws got stripped using the supplied screw driver. Therefore, I had to Dremel it so that I can re-use it. The customer service was very kind and they're going to send a mounting replacement. 

Another con was the plastic screw. I was securing the camera then the screw head snapped. Now, I have no idea how am I going to remove the unit. 

Now, hope Skybell would update the app to allow us to select multiple videos to delete.

title: Good with problems...
text: The app is working in general, but it has some questionable choices in its design: login every time? excuse me? Please add touch ID, or remember credentials forever. Swiping on notifications (even hours after the fact) brings up live video, which in turn record a new video. Why? Either only open the app or open the video recorded for that notification, but not live video. Motion detection works fine, even if the 10 sec delay is a bit too much. Overall, good, but definitely with room for improvements.

title: Horrible
text:
The new hd model is a joke. I am a proto type tester. The first ones out I found out are just testers to fix All the bugs. 1. It took 3 hours to mount it. Horrible design. Once on the wall it is never coming off without damage. App does not do what it shows. It has start and stop only. No configuration at all. It takes 5 min to disconnect and if you don't stay on the app it will never close. You get time out messages 4 out of 5 times of connecting. If you make more than one doorbell connection there is no way to delete it. I will say the few time
I got it to connect the image was very good. But slow and pixelated at times. They blew this one.

title: Slow motion detection, duplicate notifications
text:
Video capture of people that trigger motion detection was never great, but with a recent update it is now worse.  The person would basically have to stand in the SkyBell camera's field of view for several seconds before they are actually captured on video.  Presumably a firmware update will address this problem soon.

I also get two duplicate notifications for the same event.  For example, motion detection will result in two push notifications, and similarly for a button press.

The app still needs refinement.

title: Update and its all good!
text:
5stars now with update! recording few seconds ahead so you see a person approaching before bell was pressed or motion detection starts!(Exactly how all reviewers requested, before you only saw person's back away from where the sky bell is located). I guess only catch is the recorded video is saved fee seconds later but thats totally understandable.

I am very happy with how it works.

title: Becoming more of a hassle
text: I like several of the reviewers really liked this product. However, over the past several months the notifications have become spotty and I have to keep re-syncing it. Tonight nothing worked and even after stating successful configuration it would not load the configuration settings. It is starting to become a hassle and right now it is useless. Hopefully my email into their service team will fix this once and for all...

title: Good idea, horrible execution
text:
Non-stop issues. Some days it won't record, some days you can't talk with someone at the door, some days it doesn't work at all period. The motion detection is a joke, it goes off every 3 minutes to the point you just have to turn it off (and turning that function is off is the only solution their help dept gives as well). 
When the thing works, it's great. But it's rare to string more than a couple days together without more/new issues arising. 
I have a very tech filled house, I thought this would be a good addition. My mistake. 
I wouldn't recommend this product to anyone.

title: Worthless Junk
text: The SkyBell is useless! Everything worked OKAY at best the first 3 months but over the past three months I have not been able to connect. The sensor is late so only records activity after a person has walked away. Get notifications that activity is at front door but have to restart the app at least 20x to watch anything. The app only works when I am NOT connected to wifi even when I am the same network I can't connect. Avoid this app and overall the product.

title: So much more than a doorbell!
text: In my estimation, this is one of the most highly innovative, easy to use products I've seen in 25 years.  It provides REAL security and real prevention as opposed to the illusion of security that I get from my alarm system.  The probability of catching a thief?  100%. The probability of avoiding a bad situation at my front door?  Very high!!  All at an absurdly low price for the value.  Thanks, SkyBell!

title: Seems to do the job - Could be better
text:
Just installed my SkyBell trim HD today. Installation is fairly simple and getting it setup on the network was a breeze.  App functionality is pretty good but could have a few more options. For instance, being able to have the quiet mode automatically turn on/off at specific times during the day (like kids nap or night time).

I will try to come back and update after a couple of weeks of use.

title: Awesome product... could always use some improvement
text: Product is awesome, the app could use some work in a few places.  Started getting double notifications of doorbell presses (not sure when it started).  Maybe add date to the recorded videos.  Interesting idea... use the app to record constant video to a network connected hard drive (more of a security camera feature).

title: Very clunky
text: I love the idea but it's still very rough around the edges. It takes a full second or more to recognize that someone's there by which time they might be headed away from the door and you would never see their faces. Also with iOS 10.2 I cannot ever get a video stream overthe T-Mobile connection. Even on Wi-Fi the video starts very slow - takes 2 to 3 seconds just to get the video up. Hopefully these shortcomings will be patched with future firmware updates and app updates?

title: Good device - decent app
text:
Love the device. The app is ok but a few frustrations that I hope future versions will cleanup. 

First - deleting videos (motion activation will create a lot) takes a long time. Ability to select multiple videos for deletion at once would be helpful. 

Second - all the video thumbnails constantly refresh which slows down the deletion process. Caching these would save both time and cellular data usage. A user isn't going to have thousands of these so not that much memory. 

Finally motion activation doesn't record until a person is gone which is only a few seconds from when they arrive (dropping off package, etc). Any way to capture the moment the motion began would be nice as most evil-doers aren't going to hang around very long.

title: Solid stable app
text:
This app does does everything it's suppose too.  You get a nice list of all your motion activity videos. Changing the color of the light on the door bell is one of my favorite things to do in the app. 

Feature request. Wish there was a way to delete a batch of videos by day or all at once.  

Depending on your sensitivity you can quickly accumulate lots of videos you don't want.

title: Absolutely love this thing!
text: I installed my device in the middle of 2016 and absolutely love this thing, as does my wife. In fact, liked it so much I ensured that several of my friends and business associates got one and installed it. Great quality video day or night and the microphone and speaker work surprisingly well. Very happy, highly recommend!

title: So great
text:
I love my Skybell!  Works great, easy to set up and the picture quality is amazing!  Thank you for making a great product in a sea of subpar junk!

Edit:  I still love it!  And I really love the new update that makes a jingle sound when the skybell detects activity which reserves the full ding-dong sound for when the button is pressed.

title: Stopped Working on all our Apple devices
text:
I loved this app up until yesterday when all three of our Apple devices was required to log-in.  The password did not work which annoyed me as I have jot password when I installed the apps a few month back.  I tried to reset the password and the message box indicated "check your email?"  I have not received any email so I can reset the password. I tried multiple times. 

My husband who has an Anroid phone has no issue. What's up with the Apple apps. (I have the latest iOS on all devices.)

title: Skybell not bad
text: App goes down when opening every few uses. Camera itself if triggered by motion takes 30 secs. to reset and be useful. Good quality and color pictures even at night. No problems there. Like it very much. You can actually zoom in and then out, move side to side on live recording.

title: Not sure anymore
text: I brought the product and worked for few days and then video stopped working. I was told by support, firmware needs to be updated and will be pushed but it has been 3 days and video still not working. Wish it can be fixed or it has become a very expensive door bell. Still within return window, will be patient for one more day and of to Ring product.

title: Love & Hate
text: Love the quality, HD video, and great audio but it crashes when I tap to get into settings. I have been unable to adust anything like notifications, motion detection or any of the setting so for now its just a video door bell. I was running the app on the iphone 5s with IOS 8.1.2 and it cheashed so I updated the IOS to the latest version 9.3.5 and it still crashes. As of today I have 7 days left  to return it for a full  refund so please fix the app.

title: Good, but needs improvement
text: The hardware is great. There should be an option to downgrade the video output to something lower than HD, so it can work over slower networks. Also it would be great if I could set the section for the motion detection. That way trees that blow in the wind won't alert my phone that motion is detected. Overall, this is a cool product with great potential with a few improvements to the software.

title: Needs Work
text: There are two major problems with this product. First, detection is too slow. By the time the video starts, the person at the door is gone. Second, you cannot start a live stream when someone rings the doorbell. I can start a live feed any other time, just not when someone rings the doorbell. Once the triggered video has finished recording, then I am able to establish a live video feed again. This makes the product useless. On a positive note, at least the video, when you can see it, is pretty good.

title: Better safe than sorry!
text: I really love my SkyBell, being a single woman living along it gives me the piece of mind that I need. The app is so simple to use and very user friendly! I like that it is easy to view past videos and save them to my phone if needed. I also love that I can change the color of the SkyBell!

title: App glitchy and needs improvements
text:
App is very glitchy and needs major improvements:

2) add ifttt support to turn off led light at sunrise and turn on at sunset

title: Installment issue
text:
I have been trying to connect my Samsung galaxy S7 to my SkyBell for over a week now. I correctly follow the steps but every time I try to set up process I get an error message. I tried calling Skype phone but was answering buy a machine! Poor customer service!! I'm frustrated now and am looking into canceling my subscription! When I called Skybell HD they said there was a ridiculous cancellation fee. That to me feels like a slap in the face for a product that doesn't even work.

title: Close out your background apps
text: It works really well for me.  Whenever video starts taking slightly longer than usual, sure enough I forgot to close out a bunch of apps.  As soon as I do, or reset the phone, boom works perfect.  Motion detection has finally become reliable.  Would recommend.

title: Constant crashes, useless
text:
My SkyBell has not been working right for months, the app refuses to open notifications unless I force close the app and reopen, by then the person has left. title: Easy as Pie!

title: App Reverted to Prior Version!

title: Has some flaws but works well

When I do get a good connection, it works fine. Amazed at how good resolution is at only 720dpi setting. Love how it lets me save right away to my iCloud with no monthly fees.

title: Love my Skybell
text: This device is unbeatable!  Such a peace of mind when you're away from home and know who and when someone is at your door. The ability to communicate with the person is amazing.  The video quality is impeccable!!  Highly recommend this product to any home owner.

title: Absolutely love!
text: My husband and I absolutely love the SkyBell app. It provides us with a sense of comfort and security that we didn't have before. The only minor complaint I have is that since the app update I've been receiving two notifications every time the skybell detects motion or when the button is pressed. Other then that we love our skybell!!

title: Love our Skybell
text: I've been very happy ever since I got our Skybell about a year ago. We have two of them.  Great addition to our smart home. Not crazy about the new wind chime sound. Any chance you could give us the option of what sound to hear for motion and doorbell press?

title: Love my skybell
text:
The picture is clear but not the voice, hopefully they will improve it later. Technical support were excellent. Elliot took his time to help me, even checking my router until the camera worked. Also Kyle helped me when I had a problem with the tapes.
I am satisfied with this product and the customer support.

title: Too many alerts
text: I like the device and the motion detection is excellent. But recently it has started giving me three or four alerts for the same motion. Tech support had me reset everything which didn't help so I deleted it and re synced. Still does it. I think it started after I put my wife's phone as a guest.

title: You can still download videos
text: I was a bit concerned about updating the app because one of the reviews said you can't download video. On the video files if you swipe to the left give you option to download or delete.

title: Huge Improvement over 2.0
text: Absolutely love my SkyBell HD! I originally had the 2.0, but this is light years better than the 2.0. If you are trying to decide which one to get. Go with the HD. Camera quality is incredible, and you have the full color HD night vision on this as well.

title: New update removed dl feature?

This most recent update has removed the download arrows and as far as I can tell the download capability from the app which is super frustrating. I have a video that I need to download and do not have the ability to do so. Please help.

title: Buggy App
text: When you have the app running in the background and push notification happens app simply will not refresh latest recordings or allow you to access live view.
